It looks like setting `required="-1"` in an element description is [interpreted as a deprecation flag by the sdformat parser](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/1fe715d1c91a6057374055b92e75ae2b3cbc1529/src/parser.cc?at=default#cl-447). It also looks like the element will be skipped, so marking something as deprecated will provide a console message but will render the element unusable.

Perhaps we should add a new sdformat description attribute for deprecation? This way the value can still be parsed, while providing the warning message about deprecation.
content.html:
It looks like setting required="-1" in an element description is interpreted as a deprecation flag by the sdformat parser. It also looks like the element will be skipped, so marking something as deprecated will provide a console message but will render the element unusable.

Perhaps we should add a new sdformat description attribute for deprecation? This way the value can still be parsed, while providing the warning message about deprecation.
